author: Shehan Jeyarajah
title: Former Baylor WBB star Brittney Griner suspended for portion of future USA Basketball camp
text:
Former Baylor women's basketball star and current Phoenix Mercury post Brittney Griner will be hit with a partial suspension at the next USA Basketball camp she attends following her involvement in a domestic violence case earlier this year, according to a release from the organization from today.
Griner will be suspended from 20 percent of the next USA Basketball Women's National Team camp she attends from the moment she arrives at camp.
"USA Basketball does not condone violence of any sorts," said USA Basketball CEO Jim Tooley in a statement disseminated to the media. "USA Basketball has conducted extensive interviews with everyone involved and because Brittney has continued to show remorse and has dealt with this issue head-on, USA Basketball believes that the discipline it is imposing on Brittney is appropriate and fair."
In April, Griner and then-fiancÃ©e Glory Johnson, a player for the Tulsa Shock, were arrested and charged with disorderly conduct after an altercation at their mutual home in Arizona.
Griner accepted a plea deal and pleaded guilty to disorderly conduct and agreed to attend 26 weeks of domestic violence counseling. After completion, the charges will be expunged from her record. Griner and Johnson were married on May 9, but Griner filed for an annulment less than a month after the fact.
The WNBA suspended Griner and Johnson for the first seven games of the regular season, though Johnson was on maternity leave.
Griner was a two-time national player of the year for Baylor women's basketball, including leading the Lady Bears to a perfect 40-0 national championship season in 2012. She won her first WNBA Championship with the Phoenix Mercury in 2014.
